title: Bug 14807Doing backward find/replace all causes infinite loop
OB: Bug 14807Doing backward find/replace all causes infinite loop ", but the insertion point will stay at the endof the newly inserted text. It will then see "test.a.b" and do another replace,giving "test.test.a.b", etc. The replace gets stuck in an infinite loop.The only way to stop the process is to terminate the Eclipse process.When doing a backward search/replace, the insert caret should be placed beforethe newly replaced text to avoid this.
SR: Build 20020412In an editor window, type the following:a.bPut the cursor at the end of the text.Select EditFind/Replaceset the following dialog settings:Backwardfind: a.replace with: test.a.Click Replace AllThe editor will replace the "a.
